SENT.plain: There is a tendency to call benign focal epilepsy of childhood with centrotemporal origin rolandic epilepsy for the sake of brevity
Martinus Rulandus, a 16th-century medical author, deserves this homage far more than Rolando
Attention is drawn to this 1597 description of the disease, which has become the subject of many publications since 1952
Many characteristics of the disease were already noticed about four centuries ago
